title: Truth and Semantics
descriptions:
The "Truth and Semantics" grant proposal aims to provide a unified perspective on natural language semantics, focusing on truth-conditional semantics and theories of self-applicable truth related to semantic paradoxes. The project will address key challenges such as the role of truth in semantics and the foundations of semantics. 

Specific objectives include developing semantic accounts for rich fragments of natural language, encompassing the notion of truth, modal expressions, propositional attitudes, and natural language conditionals. Additionally, the project will explore the metasemantic perspective on the role of truth in the foundations of natural language semantics.

The expected outcome of this project is the first systematic study of truth and natural language semantics from a combined perspective, shedding light on the intricate relationship between truth and semantics. By delving into these complex issues, the project aims to contribute significantly to the field of linguistics and philosophy, offering new insights and approaches to understanding the nature of truth in natural language. This grant proposal seeks funding to support research activities, data collection, and dissemination of findings to the academic community and beyond.
